questions.text: When starting a new project, what excites you most?

options.text: Connecting with people who can help make it happen
Ensuring all details are perfectly organized
Sensing the right timing to launch

questions.text: In a team setting, you naturally:

options.text: Focus on systems and efficient processes
Maintain stability and support the team

questions.text: What's your biggest challenge with money?
In your ideal workday, you spend most time:

dynamo.name: Dynamo Genius
dynamo.description: You're naturally creative and innovative, seeing possibilities others miss. Like Richard Branson and Steve Jobs, you excel at starting things but may struggle with finishing details.
plan: 1. Create a 'Completion System': Partner with a Steel or Tempo genius who excels at details and timing.
2. Set 'Innovation Time': Block 2-3 hours daily for creative work without interruptions.
3. Implement the '3-Day Rule': Wait 3 days before acting on new ideas to avoid distraction.
4. Build a 'Dynamo Dashboard': Track only 3 key metrics for each project.
5. Create a 'Not-To-Do List': Identify tasks that drain your energy and delegate them.

blaze.name: Blaze Genius
blaze.description: You're a natural connector and communicator, building relationships effortlessly. Like Oprah Winfrey and Bill Clinton, you magnify opportunities through people but may overlook details.
plan: 1. Create a 'Relationship Map': Identify 20 key relationships to nurture quarterly.
2. Implement 'Focus Fridays': Dedicate one day weekly to deep work without meetings.
3. Build a 'Blaze Brief': Create templates for routine communications.
4. Partner with a Steel genius: Have them handle data and systems.
5. Practice the '1-3-5 Rule': Daily, achieve 1 big, 3 medium, and 5 small tasks.

tempo.name: Tempo Genius
tempo.description: You're grounded and intuitive, with excellent timing and perseverance. Like Warren Buffett and Mother Teresa, you create value through perfect timing but may resist change.
plan: 1. Create a 'Tempo Trigger': Establish a clear signal for when to act on opportunities.
2. Implement 'Innovation Partnerships': Collaborate with Dynamo geniuses.
3. Build a 'Tempo Tracker': Monitor market rhythms and personal energy cycles.
4. Practice 'Strategic Risk': Take 1 small calculated risk monthly.
5. Create a 'Growth Ritual': Spend 30 minutes daily learning something new.

steel.name: Steel Genius
steel.description: You're detail-oriented and systematic, creating order from chaos. Like Mark Zuckerberg and Ray Kroc, you build efficient systems but may struggle with people connections.
plan: 1. Create a 'Steel System': Document all processes in a central manual.
2. Implement 'People Time': Schedule 3 short social interactions daily.
3. Build a 'Delegation Dashboard': Identify tasks only you should do.
4. Partner with a Blaze genius: Have them handle relationships and communication.
5. Practice 'Visionary Hour': Weekly, spend 60 minutes on big-picture thinking.
